TopicTitle: [0.21.1] Ordan Industries Telescope! Last Updated August 23, 2013!

The map zoom bugs are known, but unfortunately I don't know of a fix offhand. I might look into something in the future.

The easiest way to fix the map bug is to go back into the space center and come back out again.

It's in the readme.

That's too ambiguous for me to fix.

I apologize hubbazoot, I thought I had replied with quote to Metapher. I was referring to the graphics glitches with orbits that Metapher screenshot above me.

The map glitch is a known bug. I have an idea as to what causes it, but I haven't looked into developing a fix for it yet.

As for the planets rendering a little funky, I'm not sure what's up with that. I noticed that in the latest version, too. It's something they've changed as they used to be completely clear.

The map glitch is a known bug. I have an idea as to what causes it, but I haven't looked into developing a fix for it yet.

As for the planets rendering a little funky, I'm not sure what's up with that. I noticed that in the latest version, too. It's something they've changed as they used to be completely clear.

It might have something to do with distance. It's usually Jool, Dres and Eeloo that appear funky. I've also noticed that the phase of the planet appears to be off. Like when looking at the map the body should be illuminated on the left half, but it's a quarter on the right. Or one specific one where I was looking almost through the sun at Moho, but Moho appeared to be on the dark side, but should have been fully illuminated.

If they've changed the way things are rendered, I'm not sure that you can do anything about it. Seems like you sort of got sucked back into developing this, so you may not even have the desire to look into it.

But for those of us that love this mod, thanks! I suggest it to anyone who asks about science mods.
Sunspots through the small telescope from fairly low solar orbit.

If you're getting hexagons, I'm guessing you didn't uninstall Kethane completely. There's probably a plugin or something hiding somewhere.

I tried it on a fresh ksp and it still happened

I like this mod and its concept, its just too buggy for me to use right now. I get the blurred planets as shown above and alot of shake when trying to use it, Ill be looking for updates of it in the future!
Downloading...
So, is this still under development?
I think I've lost interest/ability in working on this project. If anyone has any interest in taking it over, let me know.
